WorkItem.ClosedComment: Fixed in next release, the calculation of the number of DP ticks was correct but as it was multiplied by the full damage of a DP it was indeed giving a much too much value (4 times too high to be precise).
WorkItem.Description:
Deadly Poison damage is exceptionally high in Rawr 2.3.12. Loading my guildie's rogue (see attachment), Rawr reports her DP damage as a whopping 21% of total damage. In any log you can see it should be more like 5%.
Â 
The formula seems to be wrong. In CalculationsRogue, dPDamageRaw is calculated as the total damage a single application of DP deals over time. RogueRotationCalculator simply multiplies that number my the amount of expected ticks, which is wrong. Damage needs to be divided by four somewhere (12 seconds of 3-second ticks).

Comments.Message:
Yeah, I've changed that calculation quite some times now. Time to redo it from scratch as I kinda lost the overview.
I'm going to look at it (again :P) and fix it properly this time.
